ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Kill-stealing bards?
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think it is DoT based on the class that actually does the steal since in our case it was a ranger purely working on piercing only and not casting
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think it is DoT based on the class that actually does the steal
since in our case it was a ranger purely working on piercing only and not
casting spells... Could be DoT based on the side that looses the kill
though and maybe has something to do with overlapping DoTs there... For us
it was shaman DoTs, druid DoTs and my poison sword DoT...


----- Original Message -----
From: Kimes, Dean W. <dean_kimes@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2000 10:40 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Kill-stealing bards?


> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
> Shouldn't one pulse of our CoD be easily able to KS then? If pets aren't
> part of the equation it should be easy to test. If pets are involved
maybe
> it would be easiest to test with a level 3 bard and a level 3 pet class.
> Have the bard CoD it once then step back and let the other caster kill it
> with pet. To test if its overlapping DoT's, use a necro who can DoT for
> more than a single cycle of CoD.
>
> Kit
> <wondering why we are thinking up ways to do Verant's job for them>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2000 9:40 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Kill-stealing bards?
>
>
> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Wed, 15 Mar 2000, Jeff Illian wrote:
> >
> > Is this another one that us bards are going to have to go out and
> > find/document/prove or is Verant already aware of this?
>
> I think they're aware of it (many of the players seem to be),
> but haven't been able to reproduce it. I really do think it's
> somehow connected to pets or DoTs. If I can figure out how to
> reproduce it (difficult since we're not really a pet/DoT
> class), you can be sure I'll report it.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
